comment: Super easy class. Her discussions and paper have clear guidelines and if you read them you will get easy A's on them. There is an end of semester project, but she gives you options and wants you to be creative with it. Also reached out to students mid semester to see if anyone has any feedback for her. I recommend her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Do NOT take her. I reviewed these ratings with presumption that students were unreasonably critical of her teaching style and gave her the benefit of the doubt but I was wrong...As most of these ratings have denoted: she is unreasonable if you miss an assignment, the workload is tedious and SIGNIFICANTLY time consuming, and treats you like a child.

comment:
(CRJU 1101)

Professor Perry wasn't necessarily a bad instructor, but she was often unreasonable and tended to treat our class like children. Despite her strict grading, her feedback was minimal and unhelpful (for discussion posts/papers). The workload wasn't excessive, but it was detailed and time-consuming. No clear responses by email either.

PLEASE READ BEFORE TAKING THIS CLASS! I do not recommend this lady class. She is awful I wanted to be a lawyer but her class takes all the fun out of law. I've changed career paths. She made a classmate of mine email her, her grandfathers proof of death so she could make up a test online. Just a regular test that's 10 questions.

Insane work load. Quizzes were hyper specific & Prof required 50 pages of textbook to be read by Wednesday. Closed modules too quickly and didn't open them before Monday. Super duper difficult for no reason. If I had to take this Prof again, I would rather switch my whole major or just drop out of school.

comment: Had trouble hearing the audio in her online lectures, it sounded like they were recorded underwater. Be prepared to read the textbook in order to pass quizzes. There is zero feedback on bad discussion board grades and point deductions.

Prof Perry was not very helpful and would not understand why students needed help studying for tests. Also deducted points on discussion replies if you used "I agree" in the reply. She also would not give any feedback as to what you did wrong on discussions. She always said she was there to help, but seemed confused why help was even needed.

Gives lecture videos half the time on the content and requires no quizzes so the only grade you receive for the first half of the course is discussions. She gives you 50's with no feedback to 300 word posts include citing's from the book. Reply's to your peer that include 150 words are also shoddy work according to the professor
